pros: The team work in the organization is superb and the collaboration is endless

pros: Lots of highly skilled, smart and driven people work in this organization. Direct service staff are caring and compassionate.
cons: It can be a very high-stress environment, and there needs to be more done about equity and inclusion, particularly within leadership. Very little diversity in top administration and management/director roles. Not many opportunities to advance within the organization.

pros: Nice place to live but salary was insufficient
cons: Executives very much take care of themselves to the detriment of the people doing the work. I worked here for 5 years with no promotion or meaningful raise. People are prompted and given positions based on who they know despite lacking the expertise or education.

pros: Good management, great coworkers, fair pay for the area.
cons: Human Resources is a nightmare. No conversation about change in pay.

pros: good place, nice people, interesting

review_title: Employer of Choice in the Mountains

Exceptional comprehensive benefits including tuition reimbursement and professional development support in addition to health, dental, vision, retirement, mental health support, life insurance and disability. 
Generous compensation and smart, driven people who care about their work and the community.
cons: Have had some growing pains as the organization has expanded in establishing clear processes and procedures.

job_title: Director of Total Rewards in Edwards, CO
pros: The Leadership of Vail Health really cares about their employees. They constantly strive to come up with new and innovative ways to support employees both at the work place and home to ensure there is work-life balance. The benefits package is AMAZING!
cons: It is expensive to live here, but Vail Health continues to support employees through innovative benefit and compensation programs.

pros: Great place to work for. Mostly great coworkers, good job, and great food.

job_title: Senior Director of Development in Edwards, CO
pros: Flexible work schedule, beautiful place to live, kind coworkers, many ways to get involved in the community and be outdoors, focus on population health and access, outreach to LatinX community
cons: our area is isolated from larger metro areas, Denver is 2 hours away so accessible

review_title: New Leadership Great!--  Older Leadership Needs to Go
pros: Clinical staff and new leadership are wonderful to work for and very focused on the mission statement.
cons: No education budget for non-clinical personnel and several of the directors located under the CFO have been there for over a decade and do not feel they need to put in any effort ...they are constantly on leave or vacation and when they do work it seems to be only a 5 hour day. Most of the staff that cover for them do not get credit or rewarded for doing their own job as well as their own boss' job for years....it gets a bit frustrating when your boss has an I don't care attitude .

review_title: Unorganized, HR is not confidential, so much potential is wasting away.
pros: Weather & coworkers. Small town feel.
cons: If you like stress & mental breakdowns, this is the place for you. The ears of the execs are closed to what is really happening. Inflexible work environment & micromanaging will never make for happy employees; on top of the fact that nothing works. Is it because the higher-ups don't know exactly what's going on (do they know & they're honestly just letting it happen?) or can they honestly not find someone to fix? They need to practice what they preach on quality of life here, because their employees are dropping like flies. Losing a lot of great men & women that really care..... because you don't.

review_title: Good place to work for a shorter amount of time
pros: I liked the atmosphere as it was very active.  Most of the staff was nice; however, if people had worked at the hospital for a long time, it generally meant they were jaded and not the nicest individuals to spend time with.  Promotions and pay raises were slow, but possible.
cons: There were some long hours with little time for vacation.  Pay was lower than working at a retail shop in Vail, but the work was certainly more fulfilling.

review_title: Great employer in the Vail Valley
pros: They are always looking to improve pay and benefits. In the last two years our cost of benefits have decreased one year and stayed the same the next year, with added benefits! Tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, Education Funds, Childcare reimbursement, Certification awards. They even have Pet insurance! The people we work with are family
cons: No ski pass (unless you work for VVSC a partner with VH).  Little room for advancement. Every time a leader/management role comes up, the hire from the outside.

pros: You only work three days per week, got a great insurance for the family, got opportunity to get a better job in the company, get raise in the salary every year, holyday are paid double.
cons: it was almost 13 hours of work per day and is a dangerous job because you stay in contact with sick people (you need to be  careful)

review_title: Great Company, Wonderful People, Leadership is top notch!

pros: Leadership, Team mentality, Values and Mission, Helpful, Caring employees, Benefits,
cons: The only Con right now during this time is the amount of meetings we attend every day. To substitute for the hallway conversations we could have if COVID didn't exist.

review_title: Could not be happier with the organization!  I look forward to spending the rest of my career here.
